div1.p: In the Circuit Court at the United States for the District of Oregon
The United States vs. Columbia George and Toy Toy
Indictment Record of verdict; record of sentence
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Oregon
United States of America, vs. Columbia George and Toy Toy.
Indictment. Violation of Section 5339 as amended by Act of January 15th 1897.

District of Oregon, ss.
The Grand Jurors of the United States of America, chosen, selected and sworn within and for the District of Oregon, in the name and by the authority of the United States of America, upon their oaths do find and present:

That Columbia George, an Indian, and Toy Toy, an Indian, did on the 24th day of August, 1900, upon the Umatilla Indian Reservation, within the State and District of Oregon, purposely and of their deliberate and premeditated malic and forethought kill and murder one Annie Edna, an Indian woman, by then and there adminstering to her the said Annie Edna a lethal dose of posion, namely strychine, from which said lethal dose of strychine so adminstered by the said Columbia George and Toy Toy, Indians aforesaid, the said Annie Edna then and there died; contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the United States of America.
Dated at Portland, Oregon, this 21st day of October, 1901
Witnesses sworn and examined before the U.S. Grand Jury: R.C. Hinton A.P. Woodward Jas. McElroy B.F. McElroy W.G. Cole Ula Slate Ed Brisbo
Chas. E. Ladd Foreman of the U.S. Grand Jury
John H. Hall U.S. District Attorney
Endorsed: A true Bill. Chas. E .Ladd, Foreman U.S. Grand Jury Filed October 22, 1901. J.A. Sladen, Clerk U.S. Circuit Court District of Oregon
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Oregon
The United States vs. Columbia George and Toy Toy.
No. 2699. Octoer 24, 1901. INDICTMENT. Section 5339, as amended by Act of January 15, 1897.

Now, at this day, comes into Court the Grand Jury impaneled herein, and though its foreman, presents to the Court an indictment charging the above named defendants, Columbia George and Toy Toy, with murder, in violation of Section 5339 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, as amended by Act of Congress of January 15, 1897, which indictment is received by the Court and ordered to be filed. And, thereupon, comes the plaintiff herein by Mr. John H. Hall, United States Attorney, and the above named defendants in their own proper persons and by Mr. J.H. Raley, of counsel, and upon being arraigned upon said indictment, for plan thereto, say they are "Not Guilty" as charged therein.
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Oregon
The United States vs. Columbia George and Toy Toy.
We, the jury in the above entitled cause, find the defendant, Columbia George, guilty of murder as charged in the indictment, without capital punishment.
We, the jury in the above entitled cause, find the defendant, Toy Toy, guilty of murder as charged in the Indictment, without capital punishment.
James Steel, Foreman
Filed November 23, 1901. J.A. Sladen, Clerk U.S. Circuit Court, District of Oregon
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Oregon
The United States, vs. Columbia George and Toy Toy.
No. 2699. December 3, 1901. Indictment. Section 5339, amended by Act of January 15, 1897.
United States of America District of Oregon.

I, J.A. Sladen, Clerk of the United States Circuit Court for the District of Oregon, do hereby certify that the foregoing copy of Indictment; record of pleas; verdict; record of sentence, in cause No. 2699, United States - vs. Columbia George and Toy Toy, has been by me compared with the original thereof, and that it is a correct transcript therefrom, and of the whole of such original, as the same appears of record and on file at my office and in my custody.

In testimony whereof I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the seal of said Court at Portland, in said District, this March 24 A.D., 1906.
J. A. Sladen, Clerk By A. N. Moore, Deputy Clerk
